events.originalText: A former employee carried out a mass stabbing at a care home for disabled people in Sagamihara, Japan, killing 19 people and wounding 26 others.
events.subtitle: Sagamihara stabbings
events.headline: Mass stabbing at care home in Sagamihara, Japan: 19 killed, 26 wounded

events.originalText: The New Irish Republican Army was formed from a merger of a number of dissident republican militant groups.
events.subtitle: New Irish Republican Army
events.headline: New Irish Republican Army formed from merger of militant groups

events.originalText: After widespread controversy throughout Wales, Shambo, a black Friesian bull that had been adopted by the local Hindu community, was slaughtered due to concerns about bovine tuberculosis.
events.subtitle: Shambo
events.headline: Controversy in Wales as Shambo the bull slaughtered over tuberculosis concerns

events.originalText: Asiana Airlines Flight 733 crashed into a mountain during a failed attempt to land at Mokpo Airport, South Korea, leading to the deaths of 68 of the people on board.
events.subtitle: Asiana Airlines Flight 733
events.headline: Asiana Airlines Flight 733 crashes in South Korea: 68 dead

events.originalText: After coming second to Nguyễn Văn Thiệu in a rigged presidential election, Trương Đình Dzu was jailed by a South Vietnamese military court for illicit currency transactions.
events.subtitle: Nguyễn Văn Thiệu
events.headline: Trương Đình Dzu jailed after rigged presidential election in South Vietnam

events.originalText: The Battle of the Samichon River, the last engagement of the Korean War, ended only a few hours before the Korean Armistice Agreement was signed.
events.subtitle: Battle of the Samichon River
events.headline: Battle of the Samichon River ends as Korean Armistice Agreement is signed

events.originalText: In Short Creek, Arizona, police conducted a mass arrest of approximately 400 Mormon fundamentalists for polygamy.
events.subtitle: Colorado City, Arizona
events.headline: 400 Mormon fundamentalists arrested in Short Creek, Arizona for polygamy

events.originalText: The Canadian National Vimy Memorial (unveiling pictured), dedicated to the Canadian Expeditionary Force members killed in the First World War, was unveiled in Pas-de-Calais, France.
events.subtitle: Canadian National Vimy Memorial
events.headline: Canadian National Vimy Memorial unveiled in Pas-de-Calais, France

events.originalText: L. L. Zamenhof (pictured) published Unua Libro, the first publication to describe Esperanto, a constructed international language.
events.subtitle: L. L. Zamenhof
events.headline: L. L. Zamenhof publishes Unua Libro describing Esperanto language

events.originalText: Boer mercenaries established the Republic of Stellaland (later flag pictured) in land claimed by the United Kingdom as part of British Bechuanaland.
events.subtitle: Boers
events.headline: Boer mercenaries establish Republic of Stellaland in British Bechuanaland

events.originalText: On the orders of Catherine the Great the first of tens of thousands of Greek and Armenian Christians were removed from Crimea and resettled in Pryazovia.
events.subtitle: Catherine the Great
events.headline: Greek and Armenian Christians removed from Crimea on Catherine the Great's orders

events.originalText: French and Indian War: Rather than defend Fort Carillon, near present-day Ticonderoga, New York, from approaching British forces, French brigadier general François-Charles de Bourlamaque withdrew his troops and attempted to blow up the fort.
events.subtitle: French and Indian War
events.headline: French general withdraws troops from Fort Carillon during French and Indian War
